text: Ha, Mad? Never, never was, never have been and never will be!"

Actually, living as the Husk is not bad at all. Why do I need to reclaim my body when I can smash the enemies in this form?\\n\\nWhy do I need Black Pyramid in the first place? I can make a new one. \\n\\n[[col:red]]Warning: This is a joke event. If you're a new player and don't know what to do, conquer the Black Pyramid of Nagash and hold a ritual there.[[/col]]

You defeated the dirty crown thief. However, frankly speaking, he was a formidable foe. Moreover, he couldn't exploit his full potential because of his stubbornness. While thinking for some time, Nagash decided to make him a Mortarch and even give him a proxy crown to control him.
Nagash performs a powerful ritual to absorb the souls of other factions and make their leaders his Mortarchs. Adding their armies to his growing forces of the undead.

Nagash, seeking to expand his dominion, declares war on the other undead faction. His goal is to use his powerful magic to absorb the souls of the defeated leaders and transforms them into his loyal Mortarchs, adding their armies to his unstoppable forces of the undead.

The Great Necromancer's powers are unmatched, and even the most stalwart undead cannot resist his call. {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}} were the latest to fall to Nagash's dark magic, their wills broken by the sheer force of his necromantic power. With a mere thought, Nagash enslaved them to his will, transforming them into loyal vassals of the Grand Necromancer's ever-growing undead empire. As the ranks of the undead swell with each new conquest, the world trembles in fear, wondering which faction will be the next to fall to the unstoppable might of Nagash and his legions of the dead.

Having long-sought the means to regain his former spellcasting abilities, Luthor’s desire to repair his damaged mind has finally been realised. For years, the mental instabilities caused by his multiple personalities have prevented him from wielding the Winds of Magic, but no more – the Lore of the Deep eludes him no longer!\\n\\nAll shall fear the Pirate King more than they ever have before!
